page.title: 01Farmland/Moorland St Ola
page.content: This block of land contains rich,improved grassland grazed by beef cattle. Orkenys most important product. There are some sheep and dairy cattle. Arable land grows crops to feed on the farm (mainly barleyy) there is some rough grazing and an area of unused,unenclosed moorland. Scapa Whisky distillery is owned by a Canadian Company.All domestic refuse from the mainland and corrected south isles is buried in the incinerator in Chigliebraes Quarry. St Olaf's cemetery is where people dying in Kirkwall and St Ola are buried. The old market stance is used by Orkney Pony Club. Caldale Camp Site was a balloon unit in the 1st world war. Orkney Rugby Club is the sports ground. The road passing east/west is the northern part of the block was the main Stromners road in the last
